snippet: Instead of delivering his State of the State address, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey gave a eulogy urging lawmakers to honor Assemblyman Alex DeCroce, who died this week in the State House.
abstract: Sudden death of Alex DeCroce, longtime Republican leader of New Jersey State Assembly, upends what was to have been the opening of a new calendar; Gov Chris Christie, expected to throw out another challenge to the Democratic-controlled Legislature in his State of the State address, instead delivers a eulogy, his voice breaking as he urges lawmakers to honor their lost colleague by reviving the values of civility and bipartisanship that DeCroce embodied.

byline.contributor: Alain Delaquérière and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Instead of delivering his State of the State address, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey gave a eulogy urging lawmakers to honor Assemblyman Alex DeCroce, who died this week in the State House.

headline.seo: Alex DeCroce, Top New Jersey Republican Lawmaker, Dies
headline.main: Somber Tribute in Trenton After Assembly’s Top Republican Dies
headline.print_headline: A Somber Tribute in Trenton After the Assembly’s Top Republican Dies
